result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith J Risse

records.addlTxt: Atty. Laatsch confirmed he is not requesting substitution of Judge on this case at this time. He will confirm with a letter.

Court denies defendant's request for substitution of judge filed without attorney. Clerk emailed Atty. Laatsch/DA that court is denying defendant's request for Judge Cain to be assigned. Case has not proceeding to Arraignment at this time, defendant is entitled to file Request for Substitution of Judge thru his attorney on this case only, not the older case.
Clerk emailed Atty. Laatsch/DA Gerol inquiring as to the substitution of judge request filed by defendant, not Atty. Laatsch.  Court may review request on 11/28 at the status hearing.
Status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Cases 22CF86, 22CF326 called together - 1:36 PM Defendant Keith J Risse in court by video from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney Daryl W Laatsch in court for Keith J Risse. Cheryl Schmidt appears by SCR50 for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Laatsch requests one more date before setting a preliminary hearing on 22CF326.
Status hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant re: Substitution of Judge.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 1 clerk .
from the defendant re: request for transfer of judges. Forwarded to Clerk DK for review.
Clerk confirmed with the Court that the trial date of 11/9 can be removed from court calendar.
*TO COVER BOTH CASES (22CF86 and 22CF326)* No contact with: Victims B. or C. or any other minor female under the age of 18 years old.

1:44 PM Cases called 22CF326 and 22CF86 Defendant Keith J Risse appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Daryl W Laatsch in court for Keith J Risse.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges/penalties. For case 22CF326 State requesting $50,000 cash bail with conditions. Counsel requesting to waive time limits and set case for status on prelim hearing. Both cases to be scheduled for October 26th date.
Status hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
To accommodate Atty. Laatsch's calendar, time changed to 1:30 pm on 9/14/2022.
